comments.body: Any idea what's going on here? I'm not sure why we stopped issuing the per-property error.
I assumed it was the change in looking up the type of property names.

It's because we previously treated _all_ computed properties as having known (unit type) names, when here they actually have type `string`. Since they now have type `string` we generate a string index signature, and the elaboration logic stops trying to drill down to the properties.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +13,17 @@    var o: I = {
        ~
!!! error TS2322: Type '{ [x: string]: string | number; }' is not assignable to type 'I'.
!!! error TS2322:   Index signatures are incompatible.
!!! error TS2322:     Type 'string | number' is not assignable to type 'boolean'.
